intro: Ruellia malacosperma, commonly known as the small-leaved ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub or perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are clustered in whorls and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ruellia malacosperma is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
